children.name: diagram
children.definition: a simple plan which represents a machine, system or idea, etc., often drawn to explain how it works: biểu đồ
examples: The teacher drew a diagram showing how the blood flows through the heart.
diagram of
a diagram of the heating system
scatter diagram[specialized] a graph with points representing amounts of numbers on it, often with a line joining the points to show the pattern of the data: tản hình đồ
Venn diagram[specialized] a mathematical plan consisting of overlapping circles which show how things that belong to mathematical sets relate to each other : giản đồ Venn
flow diagram[a diagram (= simple plan) which shows the stages of a process] biểu đồ tiến trình, tiến độ

children.name: table
children.definition: an arrangement of facts and numbers in rows or blocks, especially in printed material: bảng
examples: table of
atable of results/ contents

children.name: chart
children.definition: a drawing which shows information in a simple way, often using lines and curves to show amounts: đồ thị; biểu đồ
examples: There is a chart on the classroom wall showing the relative heights of all the children.
The sales chart shows a distinct decline in the past few months.
the TVweatherchart
bar chart[a mathematical picture in which different amounts are represented by thin vertical or horizontal rectangles which have the same width but different heights or lengths] biểu đồ thanh
pie chart[a circle which is divided from its centre into several parts to show how a total amount is divided up] biểu đồ tròn
flowchart[a diagram (= simple plan) which shows the stages of a process] biểu đồ tiến trình, tiến độ

children.name: graph
children.definition: a picture which shows how two sets of information or variable amounts are related, usually by linses or curves: đồ thị; biểu đồ
examples: This graph shows how crime has varied in relationship to unemployment over the last 20 years.
Martin showed me a graph of their recent sales.

bar graph[a mathematical picture in which different amounts are represented by thin vertical or horizontal rectangles which have the same width but different heights or lengths] biểu đồ; biểu đồ thanh; biểu đồ vạch
block graph[specialized] a type of graph that shows different amounts or numbers as rectangular blocks of different sizes
a bar graph(= a picture of boxes of different heights, in which each box represents a different amount or quantity )The monthly variations in rainfall are shown on the bar graph below.
a line graphA line graph is a way of presenting figures in visual form.

children.name: draw a graph
examples: Draw a graph to show changes in the death rate over this period.

children.name: plot something on a graph
children.definition: to draw marks or a line to show facts, numbers etc on a graph
examples: The different values can be plotted on a graph.

children.name: show sth on a graph/a graph shows sth
examples: The graph shows that wages rose in line with productivity.

children.name: figure
children.definition: (written abbfig.) a picture or drawing, often with a number, in a book or other document: hình minh họa, con số
examples: Please see figures 8 and 9.

children.name: spidergram
children.definition: / mind map a diagram (= simple plan) with lines and circles for organising information so that it is easier to use or remember: biểu đồ tư duy
examples: Use spidergrams to organise your English vocabulary into different subjects.

children.name: schema
children.definition: a drawing that represents an idea or theory and makes it easier to understand: giản đồ

children.name: vertical axis
children.definition: / y-axis  the line of figures or coordinates that are arranged from top to bottom at the side of a graph or map

children.name: horizontal axis
children.definition: / x-axis  the line of figures or coordinates that are arranged from left to right along the bottom of a graph or map
